metadata.title: How to Add YouTube End Screens 2025: Complete Setup Guide
metadata.description: Set up YouTube end screens effectively. Keep viewers watching with strategic elements.

hero.headline: How to Add YouTube End Screens
hero.subheadline: Keep viewers watching. Turn video endings into new beginnings.

sections.content: End screens appear in the last 5-20 seconds, promoting more content when viewers are most engaged. A well-designed end screen drives significant additional views. They're clickable, customizable, and essential for channel growth. Here's how to set them up effectively.

content.title: Design for End Screen
content.description: Leave space in your outro. Don't cover important visuals.

content.title: Optimal Duration
content.description: 15-20 seconds gives time to click without dragging.

content.title: Strategic Content
content.description: Promote related video. 'Best for viewer' often works well.

content.title: Clear Placement
content.description: Don't cluster elements. Make them easy to click.

sections.title: End Screen Strategy
content: Use 'best for viewer' for algorithm picks
Match to video content when relevant
Design outro with elements in mind

faq.question: Minimum video length for end screens?
faq.answer: 25 seconds minimum. End screens can appear in last 5-20 seconds, so video must be at least 25 seconds. Shorts don't support end screens.

faq.question: What's 'best for viewer'?
faq.answer: Algorithm chooses video most likely to interest that specific viewer. Usually performs well. Alternative to manually selecting specific video.

faq.question: Why aren't my end screens showing?
faq.answer: Check: video over 25 seconds, not a Short, end screen properly saved. Some viewers have elements disabled. Mobile shows differently than desktop.

faq.question: How many elements should I use?
faq.answer: 2-4 elements typical. One video/playlist, one subscribe button is minimum. Don't overcrowdâ€”cluttered end screens get ignored.
